ByteBufElement Class Reference

Class describing one buffer-part in the ByteBuffer. More...

#include <ByteBuffer.h>

    Deletes the element and the bytes in it.

Detailed Description

Class describing one buffer-part in the ByteBuffer.

Definition at line 159 of file ByteBuffer.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ByteBufElement::ByteBufElement (  byte *  data,
int  len,
int  offset = 0
) 
 

Creates a new ByteBufElement.

Parameters:
data The data of the element. Will be deleted when the element is deleted.
len The length of the data.
offset The offset in the data to start at. The length includes the offset so if the length of the whole buffer is 20 and the offset is 10, positions 10-19 will be used.

virtual ByteBufElement::~ByteBufElement (   )  [virtual]
 

Deletes the element and the bytes in it.

Member Function Documentation

int ByteBufElement::ack (  int  len  ) 
 

Changes the read position forward len positions.

No checks are made, so be careful.

Parameters:
len The number of positions that the read position should be advanced.
Returns:
The number of positions that the read position was advanced.

int ByteBufElement::getNbrBytesLeft (   )  const
 

Returns the number of available bytes in the element.

int ByteBufElement::peek (  byte *  data,
int  len
) 
 

Copies bytes from the element into the supplied data area.

Returns the minimum of the number of available bytes and len.

Parameters:
bytePtr Place to put the read bytes,
len The number of wanted bytes.
Returns:
The number of bytes that can be read or len, whichever is smaller. If the return value is <= 0 the pointer to the data cannot be trusted.
